result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Jury status hearing on January 6, 2023 at 09:45 am.

Defendant Barbara S Leonard in court, in custody.  Attorney Kathleen Chung in court for Barbara S Leonard.  Attorney Annie Jay in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Chung filed a motion to modify bond-reduce cash bail. Argument by Atty Chung. Statement by Defn. Argument by ADA Jay. Argument by Atty Chung. CT makes findings and reduces cash bail to $300. All other non-monetary conditions remain the same.

Atty Chung filed a motion to modify bond-reduce cash bail. Defn requesting signature bond. Argument by Atty Chung. State objects to reducing cash bail; argument by ADA Helmberger. Argument by Atty Chung. CT makes findings and denies motion. Bail cont.

Defendant Barbara S Leonard in court, in custody.  Attorney Kathleen Chung in court for Barbara S Leonard.  Attorney Tim Helmberger in court for State of Wisconsin. Pre-trial conference on October 31, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.

9:13 AM Defendant Barbara S Leonard in court, in custody.  Attorney Kathleen Chung in court for Barbara S Leonard.  Prosecuting attorney Frank John Remington in court for the State of Wisconsin. State moved to find counts 2 & 3 transactionally related. Court found counts 2 & 3 transactionally related. Law Enforcement officer Nicholas Krahn duly sworn & testified; Venue Established; Witness ID'd defn; State moves for bindover - waives argument, reserves for rebuttal; Defense objects to bindover - waives argument; Ct binds case over; bail continued.
